citation.article-title: 'Candidatus Mycoplasma haemominutum', a low-virulence epierythrocytic parasite of cats
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Candidatus Mycoplasma haemominutum sp. nov.

Cells of Candidatus Mycoplasma haemominutum are approximately 0.3 μm in diameter, approximately half the size of Candidatus Mycoplasma haemofelis (Fig. 1). Cells of both species are Gram-positive, epicellular coccoid bodies. Ultrastructurally, Candidatus Mycoplasma haemominutum is similar to other mollicutes, with a plasma membrane, no cell wall and no internal membranous structures.

In accordance with guidelines for describing uncultivated prokaryotes (Murray & Stackebrandt, 1995), we propose giving this small feline parasite a Candidatus designation with the following description: Candidatus Mycoplasma haemominutum [(Firmicute, probable Mycoplasma) NC; Gj; C; NAS (GenBank no. U88564, U88563*); P (Felis catus, erythrocytes)].
Foley et al., Am J Vet Res 59, 1581– 1588, 1998, and Rikihisa et al., J Clin Microbiol 35, 823–829, 1997.
